parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: A pagination token for the next set of results. If the results of a search are large, only a portion of the results are returned, and a nextToken pagination token is returned in the response. To retrieve the next set of results, reissue the search request and include the returned token. When all results have been returned, the response does not contain a pagination token value.

nested_items.name: campaignSummaries
nested_items.description: A summary of information about each campaign.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a campaign.

nested_items.name: signalCatalogArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the signal catalog associated with the campaign.

nested_items.name: targetArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of a vehicle or fleet to which the campaign is deployed.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The state of a campaign. The status can be one of the following:
CREATING - Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise is processing your request to create the campaign.

WAITING_FOR_APPROVAL - After a campaign is created, it enters the WAITING_FOR_APPROVAL state. To allow Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise to deploy the campaign to the target vehicle or fleet, use the API operation to approve the campaign.
SUSPENDED - The campaign is suspended. To resume the campaign, use the API operation.

nested_items.name: creationTime
nested_items.description: The time the campaign was created.

nested_items.name: lastModificationTime
nested_items.description: The last time the campaign was modified.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: The token to retrieve the next set of results, or null if there are no more results.
